title.narrative: Sexual and Reproductive Health for All

description.narrative: Sexual and reproductive health program in Nigeria.

recipient-country.narrative: The activity is being implemented in Nigeria.

sector.narrative: The activity reported is between November 2019 to January 2020

description.narrative: Obligated funds from donor.
spending from Nov. 1 2018 - July 31, 2020

HAI and partners initiate and support the design and dissemination of self-made media (fanzines) and other forms of advocacy and reporting tools through quarterly art/media production workshops open to volunteers in their network. Participants design their own SRHR messages through flyers, posters, video and role-play to cover key SRHR issues.

HAI and partners jointly implement baseline and final study under the leadership and coordination of an expert consultant (senior SRHR advocate). This allows research assistants to connect directly with identified providers of SRH services. The assessment provides much critical information on SRH needs, gaps and resources in services, as well as key target groups and their locations, key actors to target with advocacy.

title.narrative: # of baseline studies conducted in both project sites

1 day forum for community leaders with diverse profiles to launch the project, exchange on human rights, women?s rights, SRHR, and key issues faced by most marginalized women and girls including sex workers, women who use drugs, lesbians and trans women, street girls, and others, with the aim to facilitate joint action and break silos within marginalized community.

HAI and consultant tailor a comprehensive curriculum on SRHR (including previous GBV modules, FP and birth control techniques, safe abortion and post abortion care, basics of childcare, sexual and reproductive rights, etc. in simple articulated modules).

Working in tandem, trained SRHR advocates share their knowledge step by step with their network as well as in other circles, groups and collectives of women and girls identified in the area, using each module to initiate bi monthly lasting debates with their peers in locations of their choice. They share information flyers and other media production at each session.

description.narrative: .# of key service providers who demonstrate improved ability to provide stigma free, integrated sexual and reproductive services to marginalized women and youth

title.narrative: .# of key service providers who demonstrate improved ability to provide stigma free, integrated sexual and reproductive services to marginalized women and youth

Working in tandem, trained SRHR advocates share their knowledge step by step with their network as well as in other circles, groups and collectives of women and girls identified in the area, using each module to initiate bi monthly lasting debates with their peers in locations of their choice. They share information flyers and other media production at each session.

description.narrative: Average # of people attending debates

title.narrative: Average # of people attending debates

HAI and partners initiate and support the design and dissemination of self-made media (fanzines) and other forms of advocacy and reporting tools through quarterly art/media production workshops open to volunteers in their network. Participants design their own SRHR messages through flyers, posters, video and role-play to cover key SRHR issues.

description.narrative: average # of individuals attending media production workshops

title.narrative: average # of individuals attending media production workshops

HAI trains and coaches emerging collectives in key organizational development and management procedures, following an established step-by-step methodology and using existing modules.
